talk.author: did:plc:3rpck3mptpei3h62xaia4niu
talk.utter: I live in a town with half the population of what we had 30 years ago. The off-shoring of factory work has decimated the rural midwestern economy. The same people complaining about inflation WILL accept inflation for better job opportunities in their communities. It's a gamble they're aware of.

talk.author: did:plc:uc7qdczwfrwpc5235oz3mdo4
talk.utter:
A company will not bother to build a factory when it will only be priced the same as the imported item with a tariff.  
Plus w/ record low unemployment, who is toiling in these factories?
All they will get is more inflation with no more opportunities

talk.author: did:plc:3rpck3mptpei3h62xaia4niu
talk.utter: Our current trade rules were practically written by the corporations so they could make as much as possible, at the cost of the working class. Trump won't fix anything, but a tarriff increase to make this the cheapest place to produce, while still paying well, would be Actually Good.

talk.author: did:plc:3rpck3mptpei3h62xaia4niu
talk.utter: Our current trade rules were practically written by the corporations so they could make as much as possible, at the cost of the working class. Trump won't fix anything, but a tarriff increase to make this the cheapest place to produce, while still paying well, would be Actually Good.

talk.author: did:plc:uc7qdczwfrwpc5235oz3mdo4
talk.utter:
That's a completely horrible take.  
A tariff to make it cheaper to produce here only guarantees to make everything more expensive.  
With prices going up, shopping will slow, costing jobs, creating recession and inflation

talk.author: did:plc:3rpck3mptpei3h62xaia4niu
talk.utter: Yes and offset by increasing wages throughout the country through the new manufacturing positions which would then give growth to luxury purchases, create retail opportunities outside of corporations, and spark the economy. We're trickling up right?

talk.author: did:plc:3rpck3mptpei3h62xaia4niu
talk.utter: Yes and offset by increasing wages throughout the country through the new manufacturing positions which would then give growth to luxury purchases, create retail opportunities outside of corporations, and spark the economy. We're trickling up right?

talk.author: did:plc:usbunujpot3gw67lffdg2i6g
talk.utter: Okay. I think your problem is that you are trying to look at this through sensible and logical economics. But the problem is that Trump and all his cronies don't care. They don't have to do anything to balance off anything. There is no goal of order from chaos going on here.

talk.author: did:plc:3rpck3mptpei3h62xaia4niu
talk.utter: Yeah, I'm aware. He's writing the deals to enrich him and his cronies, not the working class.

talk.author: did:plc:3rpck3mptpei3h62xaia4niu
talk.utter: Yeah, I'm aware. He's writing the deals to enrich him and his cronies, not the working class.

talk.author: did:plc:usbunujpot3gw67lffdg2i6g
talk.utter: Exactly. So anyone thinking this is some sort of plan to help anyone but themselves is unfortunately very misinformed. This is just a repeat of the last disaster, only even bigger this time to the point that countries are thinking of giving up on America completely.

talk.author: did:plc:3rpck3mptpei3h62xaia4niu
talk.utter: Spot on, things might be getting very bad. I wonder if he has an actual plot to enrich himself or if he is ruining everything for a small piece of the pie. I just had to defend the concepts of tariffs earlier.

talk.author: did:plc:3rpck3mptpei3h62xaia4niu
talk.utter: I live in a town with half the population of what we had 30 years ago. The off-shoring of factory work has decimated the rural midwestern economy. The same people complaining about inflation WILL accept inflation for better job opportunities in their communities. It's a gamble they're aware of.

talk.author: did:plc:2bwpuvajjzvulpy7opxnzuw6
talk.utter: Thatâ€™s not happening. That is NOT the plan with Trump. Trump is planning on crashing the economy, gutting the government, defunding the government, starting trade wars and THEN after what could easily be a decade of carnage he wants the free market to bring manufacturing back to America. LOL, no.

talk.author: did:plc:3rpck3mptpei3h62xaia4niu
talk.utter: I'm not defending Trump's tarrifs, hes making them for his own game. I'm defending the desire for increased tariffs in the midwest. They should be written to the benefit of the working class.
